text: The American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations, called the AFL-CIO, is a group of labor unions in the United States and Canada. There are 54 national different unions in the group, and they speak for over 10 million workers. It was started in 1955, when the American Federation of Labor and the Congress of Industrial Organizations joined after a long argument. From 1955 to 2005, almost all union workers in the U.S. were part of the AFL-CIO. However, in 2005, some large unions (like the Teamsters) left the AFL-CIO. The president of the AFL-CIO, Richard Trumka served from 2009 until his death on August 5, 2021. == Other websites == * AFL-CIO official website ** List of AFL-CIO affiliated unions ** Speeches from the 2005 AFL-CIO convention * Teamsters' Disaffiliation letter to John Sweeney, President AFL-CIO 2005 * Workers Independent News == References == Category:Trade unions in the United States
